Any type of facilitation payment is prohibited, large or small. Even where such payments are perceived as a common practice and even if our competitors engage in such practices, no violations of this principle will be tolerated.
Continue to resist any demand for this kind of payment. Say no and use the examples to help you.

Paying a small sum of money to an official to speed up a process is known as a facilitation payment. We make no distinction between facilitation payments and bribes, no matter how small the amount. Facilitation payments are illegal in most countries in which we operate and UK law forbids them anywhere in the world.
It is unlikely to be a facilitation payment if it is an official, fixed and published fee and you will get a receipt.

However, there are legitimate fees for speeding up some services such as a fee to quickly process an application. Make the payment if it is an official transaction and it has been asked for in an open and transparent way.

Record the transaction appropriately.
